doc.after: Nicolaus August Otto June 14 1832 Holzhausen Nassau January 26 1891 Cologne was the German inventor of the internal combustion engine the first engine to burn fuel directly in a piston chamber Up until his invention all engines were external combustion engines and fuel was burned in a separate compartment
